info.description:
API Gateway supports staging and promotion of assets. In a typical enterprise-level,
solutions are separated according to the different stages of Software Development
Lifecycle (SDLC) such as development, quality assurance (QA), and production stages. Staging and promotion allows you to promote all the assets across different stages. The supported assets are APIs, global policies, policy templates, applications, aliases, packages, plans, threat protection rules, administrative configurations, approval configurations, outbound proxies, URL aliases, keyStores, trustStores, JNDI provider aliases, JMS connection aliases, JMS triggers, webservice endpoint aliases, users, groups, access profiles and kerberos settings

Promotion refers to moving API Gateway assets from the source stage to one or more
target stages. For example, you might want to promote assets you have developed on
servers in a Development stage (the source API Gateway instance) to servers in a QA or
Production stage (the target API Gateway instance).

Rollback is the process of restoring the asset's metadata in the target API Gateway instance to a previous state.

Stages should be configured in the source machine where we initiate the promotion process.
info.title: API Assets Promotion Management

get.description: This REST operation is used to retrieve the promotions history with each promotion entry provides the promotion name, promoted by whom, when it's promoted and the promoted assets status

200.description: Returns the list of all promotions

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

post.description: This REST operation is used to promote the API Gateway assets from the source machine to destination machine where the destination machine is configured as a stage

x-examples.application/json: {"description":"Promoting the weather API version 2.0 to QA stage so that QA can start testing this API","name":"samplePromote","destinationStages":["2d9e280a-b529-466c-9ec8-d6b0e93026a8"],"promotedAssets":{"api":["9ae31b7f-25e6-11e8-9ed0-e261b16c5360"],"application":[]}}

parameters.name: fixingMissingVersions
parameters.description: Option to fix the API version history. The discrepancy between the asset versions in the source and target stages, if any, are fixed. The default value is false

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Option to overwrite the assets except aliases in the destination stage during asset promotion. The default value is false

parameters.name: overwriteAlias
parameters.description: Option to overwrite the asset type 'alias' in the destination stage during asset promotion. The default value is 'false'. This parameter takes precedence over the 'overwrite' parameter.

200.description: Promotion of assets is completed successfully in API Gateway.

400.description: This status code shows when the user missed the mandatory fields like destinationStages, promotedAssets in the request or provide a invalid request body

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to configure a stage.

get.description: Retrieve a promotion based on the promotion id.

parameters.name: promotionId
parameters.description: Promotion Id for the promotion to be retrieved

200.description: Returns the promotion based on the promotionId.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that the promotionId specified is not found in the API Gateway

parameters.name: promotionId
parameters.description: Promotion Id for the promotion to be deleted

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API

404.description: This status code indicates that the promotionId specified is not found in the API Gateway

get.description: This REST operation is used to retrieve the list of possible rollbacks a user can do from the local (target) API Gateway instance. Each rollback entry was created when a promotion of assets to the local (target) API Gateway instance from another stage

200.description: Returns the list of all rollbacks

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

get.description: Retrieve a rollback based on the rollback id.

parameters.name: rollbackId
parameters.description: Rollback Id for the rollback to be retrieved

200.description: Returns the rollback based on the rollbackId.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that the rollbackId specified is not found in the API Gateway

put.description: This REST operation is used to rollback the assets to the previous state i.e the state prior to promotion. Rollback should be initiated from the local gateway instance.

parameters.name: rollbackId
parameters.description: Rollback Id for the promotion to be rollbacked

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that the rollbackId specified is not found in the API Gateway

parameters.name: rollbackId
parameters.description: Rollback Id for the rollback to be deleted

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API

404.description: This status code indicates that the rollbackId specified is not found in the API Gateway

get.description: This REST operation is used to retrieve all the configured stages

200.description: Returns the list of all stages

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

post.description: This REST operation is used to configure a stage in the source API Gateway where promotion will be initiated. A stage is just another API Gateway instance. When the stage url is https, then keystore and keystore alias will also be expected while configuring a stage

x-examples.application/json:
{
	"name" : "QA Stage",
	"description" : "This stage will be used to test the assets promoted from the development stage",
	"url" : "http://mcmriz01:5555/",
	"username" : "Administrator",
	"password" : "password"
}

200.description: Stage is created successfully in API Gateway. Now user can promote API Gateway assets to the created stage

400.description: This status code shows when the user missed the mandatory fields like name, url, username, password and keyStoreAlias, keyAlias for https url in the request or provide a invalid request body

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to configure a stage.

get.description: This REST operation is used to retrieve a particular stage object based on a stage id

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: Stage Id for the stage to be retrieved

200.description: Returns the stage based on the stageId.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that the stageId specified is not found in the API Gateway

put.description: This REST operation is used to update a stage in the source API Gateway where promotion will be initiated. A stage is just another API Gateway instance. When the stage url is https, then keystore and keystore alias will also be expected while configuring a stage

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: Stage Id for the stage to be updated

400.description: This status code shows when the user missed the mandatory fields like name, url, username, password and keyStoreAlias, keyAlias for https url in the request or provide a invalid request body

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that the stageId specified is not found in the API Gateway

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: Stage Id for the stage to be deleted

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API

404.description: This status code indicates that the stageId specified is not found in the API Gateway

Basic.description: API Gateway Administrator and API Gateway provider

dependencyFailed.description: Specified whether the dependency asset is failed or not

id.description: Id of the API gateway asset

name.description: Name of the API gateway asset

overwritten.description: Specifies whether the promoted asset overwrite any existing asset or not

status.description: Status of the API gateway asset i.e success or failure

warning.description: Specified whether a warning occurred during import of the asset

ArchiveResult.description: List of the result of the promotion of all selected assets where key in the each element is the asset type

errorReason.description: Error reason for the promotion of assets, if the promotion is failed

status.description: Status of the promotion of assets

destinationStages.description: List of target stages (specified by stage ids) that you want to promote the assets

errorReason.description: Reason for the promotion if it's failed

includeApis.description: Include the APIs associated with the applications during the promotion of applications

includeApplications.description: Include the applications associated with the APIs during the promotion of APIs

includeSubscriptions.description: Include the subscriptions associated with the packages during the promotion of packages

owner.description: The user who initiates this promotion

promotedAssets.description: Map of assets with its associated asset ids to be promoted where key is the asset type and value is the list of asset ids. Possible asset types are "USER", "GROUP", "USERS", "GROUPS", "ACCESSPROFILES", "LDAPGROUPS", "CDSGROUPS", "ASSERTION", "APPLICATION", "API", "ALIAS", "POLICY", "POLICY_ACTION", "PLAN", "PACKAGE", "ADMINISTRATOR_SETTING", "PORTAL_GATEWAY", "OAUTH2_SCOPE_DATA", "SUBSCRIPTION", "API_DOCUMENT", "APPROVAL_CONFIGURATION", "OUTBOUND_PROXY", "URL_ALIAS", "KEYSTORE", "TRUSTSTORE", "KERBEROS_SETTING", "JNDI_PROVIDER_ALIAS", "JMS_CONNECTION_ALIAS", "JMS_TRIGGER", "WEB_SERVICE_ENDPOINT_ALIAS".

promotionResults.description: Result of the individual assets that is promoted to all destination stages along with the reason where key is the stage name

status.description: Overall status of the promotion whether it's success or failure

lastRollbackTime.description: The time at which the asset promotion was rolled back

promotionId.description: Id of the promotion to map the rollback with the promotion from the source stage

status.description: Overall status of the rollback whether it's success or failure

keyAlias.description:
The alias of the private key that is stored in the keystore specified by the keystore alias.
The Key alias field contains a list of the available aliases in the selected keystore. If there are no configured keystores, this field is empty

keystoreAlias.description:
The alias of the keystore containing the private key that is used for performing asset promotion from one (source) stage to another (target) stage.
The Keystore alias field contains a list of the available keystore aliases in API Gateway. If there are no configured keystore aliases, this field lists the default Integration Server keystore, DEFAULT_IS_KEYSTORE .

password.description: A valid password of the API Gateway user identified by the attribute Username

url.description: The URL of the host machine where the stage is deployed on an API Gateway installation

username.description: The username of a registered API Gateway user who has the Manage promotions functional privilege in the target API Gateway instance
